abstract:
<jats:p>
            The malic enzyme from
            <jats:italic>Halobacterium cutirubrum</jats:italic>
            requires monovalent cations for both activation and stabilization. NaCl, the best stabilizer, is ineffective as activator; NH
            <jats:sub>4</jats:sub>
            Cl, the best activator, is a poor stabilizer. These results support the idea that the roles of salts in both processes are different.
          </jats:p>
title: Effect of Monovalent Cations on the Malic Enzyme from the Extreme Halophile, Halobacterium cutirubrum

affiliation.name: Departamento de Bioquímica, Facultad de Ciencias Bioquímicas, Universidad Nacional de Rosario, Rosario, República Argentina
